column4: Small businesses are the backbone of our economy, and as #COVID19 cases surge to record levels, it’s clear they need our help more than ever. That's why I've introduced a bill to provide them an extension on the debt relief received through the #CARESAct. https://t.co/vZe3bH3iuZ

Indiana has just hit its highest number of #COVID19 cases ever. Hoosiers are hurting and need help. The House responded months ago by passing the #HeroesAct, which provides trillions more towards fighting the pandemic. What is @senatemajldr waiting for? Pass this bill ASAP! https://t.co/yH8XO6raUs

Due to the #COVID19 pandemic, @CDCgov has issued a moratorium on evictions for many Americans. The city of Indianapolis has created an online tool to find out if you qualify. Please be sure to utilize this important resource!
https://t.co/arzY0TfV0b

#COVID19 has made it clearer than ever that everyone needs reliable, high-speed broadband. Today, the #TrumpFCC doubled down on repealing #NetNeutrality. If you agree that internet access should be a right, not a privilege, join us in fighting to restore a free and open internet. https://t.co/KV7KNrAz7h

When #COVID19 first hit our country, Trump described himself as a wartime President. Now, his Administration is waving the flag of defeat.

They’re surrendering when it’s more important than ever to keep fighting. https://t.co/PC2YQWpG4f
Hoosiers — #COVID19 cases are up in our state, and we’ve got to stay vigilant. Wear a mask. Be smart. Take care of yourselves and others. Together we can beat this virus.

The ongoing #COVID19 crisis has highlighted students' need for great teachers and inspiring mentors to help get them through these tough times and beyond. I've introduced two pieces of legislation that help meet this need. Read more here: https://t.co/6Go8SsYCMc

Attention! @IRSNews is holding a live webinar tomorrow, October 9th, to help Hoosiers receive their #COVID19 Economic Impact Payment who haven't already. Don't miss this helpful and free opportunity! Register here: https://t.co/N7PceJf65c

Access to healthy & affordable food should be a right, not a luxury. Unfortunately, many neighborhoods -- known as food deserts -- lack this necessity. That's why I have reintroduced the Food Deserts Act, to help facilitate more locally-owned grocery stores in these communities. https://t.co/RlPsxmcz7V

Pres. Trump claims that Americans shouldn’t live in fear of #COVID19.  

What he doesn’t realize is that taking steps to protect ourselves & loved ones from the virus isn’t cowardly. It’s smart. 

The only thing we (rightfully) fear is his disastrous response to this pandemic.
RT @Scout_Finch: The White House has access to the best testing, the best physicians (Ronny Jackson notwithstanding), the best scientists a…
RT @LeaderHoyer: The jobs report shows that recovery we experienced from this pandemic’s job losses slowed. More than 10M Americans are une…
I'm praying for President Trump, the First Lady, and everyone who is battling #COVID19. This virus is extremely serious, and we are all at risk. Please, please be safe and take care of yourselves.

I was honored to preside over the House of Representatives tonight as we passed an updated version of the #HeroesAct. This $2.2 trillion dollar relief bill strengthens our fight against COVID-19 and its economic devastation. I urge the Senate to pass it immediately.

This new version of the #HeroesAct is estimated to provide Indianapolis with more than $293 million in funds to help fight #COVID19, protect our workers, strengthen our local economy, and much more. I will proudly vote YES and urge my Republican colleagues to do the same. https://t.co/pThwjgLRuu

The Administration’s reckless rush to nominate a #SCOTUS Justice threatens our freedoms like never before. It’s part of their plan to pack the court with far-right judges who will take away our health care, our voting rights, reproductive rights, & more. We can’t let that happen.

The #COVID19 crisis has proven how essential Hoosier small businesses are to our community. Four months ago, the House voted to provide them more relief by passing the #HeroesAct. The Senate needs to also pass this vital legislation immediately. #SmallBusinessWeek

The Jobs and Justice Act focuses on poverty alleviation, housing, development, access to quality education, criminal justice reform, environmental justice, health equity, and voting rights. #JobsandJustice2020

Today I spoke on the House floor to honor the 200,000 Americans we have lost to #COVID19. We can’t bring them back, but we can prevent future loss of life by passing the #HeroesAct immediately. https://t.co/VoTthWSP1c

Big news! The House just passed the Maternal Health Quality Improvement Act, which includes my bipartisan bill with @RepLarryBucshon that helps to reduce maternal mortality through new programs and training.

Republicans are STILL trying to repeal the #AffordableCareAct. Now -- just weeks before the election -- they want to push through a far-right #SCOTUS nominee who will support their plan to rip health coverage from millions. This is a danger to our well-being and our Democracy!
RT @RepValDemings: The right of American women to control their own bodies is at stake. Your right to vote. Your right to health care. Your…

On #RoshHashanah, my heart is with all of my Jewish brothers and sisters in Indiana and across America. May this new year bring health, hope and prosperity to all. #ShanahTovah https://t.co/TQh4hb11GE
While House Democrats are fighting #ForThePeople and our health care, Republicans are trying to take health care away from millions of Americans during a pandemic. https://t.co/0lfAdaJj49

Their anti-science attitude and disdain for science hurts our fight against COVID-19. Please work with us to pass a relief bill that saves lives  and jobs. Time is running out, and we can't waste another moment.
I urge my GOP colleagues to accept the facts about this virus and its ongoing devastation on our country.

Experts say COVID-19 cases, hospitalizations and deaths could get significantly worse this fall and winter. We need to pass a relief plan that helps prepare our country for the tough months ahead. The House has taken action by passing the #HeroesAct -- our boldest effort yet.

I want to work with Republicans on another #COVID19 relief package, but they aren't facing reality. They're taking cues from a President who thinks the pandemic is behind us and the economy has bounced back. As a result, their proposals are insufficient and don't meet the moment.

September is National #RecoveryMonth -- an occasion to spread awareness about mental health and substance abuse disorders. If you are struggling, know that you don't have to suffer in silence. We've got your back. To find treatment options, click here: https://t.co/wpyK73V6h2 https://t.co/NpzsUQinWQ
We must continue working to strengthen our rail infrastructure so we’re ready to roll when our economy rebounds after we beat this pandemic.
RT @TransportDems: TODAY: @TransportDems hold a hearing on “@Amtrak’s Response to #COVID19.” Tune in here: https://t.co/ZKOobA4MOf

The #JobsReport is not good news for our country. A growing number of Americans are permanently out of work. Millions more are employed but fear getting sick on the job.

Our economic and health crisis will worsen if we don't take action now. We must pass the #HeroesAct. https://t.co/R9neEeDvgu

Today is #NationalPollWorkerRecruitmentDay! Our nation is experiencing a significant shortage of poll workers due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Sign up to be a poll worker on November 3 here: https://t.co/6IXCDg3n1y
RT @RepAdamSmith: The @NationalGuard has played an instrumental role in #COVID19 response and recovery, serving as a critical tool for stat…

It has never been more important to protect the #AffordableCareAct. I proudly support this resolution, and I’ll keep fighting to strengthen and expand health care for every American. https://t.co/2ZcOD6dDqA

#COVID19 relief efforts coming from President Trump and GOP Senate leaders are too little too late. We need to pass the #HeroesAct to get Hoosiers the help they need and deserve during this crisis. 
https://t.co/vK7Bb8sclR

Rent is due and many families don't know how they're going to make payments amid #COVID19. The Senate's failure to act means millions could soon lose their homes. The eviction moratorium must be extended plus urgently needed rent relief. #StopEvictions #RentReliefNow

The @SenateGOP #COVID19 relief plan is too little too late. It rejects science, slashes unemployment benefits and doesn't do enough for frontline workers. The House passed the #HeroesAct months ago. I urge my GOP colleagues to support this bolder, better plan for Americans.

#EidMubarak to all of my fellow Muslims observing #EidAlAdha in our community and around the world! This Eid, we have an important opportunity to reflect on the true value of sacrifice, as we celebrate this joyous time from home. I wish everyone a healthy and safe celebration!

Good news! The city of Indianapolis has awarded $2.7 million dollars in Emergency Services Grants from the #CARESAct to several organizations helping Hoosiers who are experiencing homelessness. As we continue to struggle through #COVID19, this will be a big help to many.

1) This economic free fall could have been prevented had the Trump Admin. taken the #COVID19 threat seriously from the start.
 
2) We can prevent future damage by passing the #HeroesAct, which strengthens our fight against the virus and helps protect millions from financial ruin. https://t.co/EJSBWk9W0q
I dedicate this amendment to his memory, and to the ongoing fight to achieve justice in all areas of our society -- including health care.

#COVID19 has exacerbated racial and gender inequality, and it will only get worse if we don't take action. That's why we must enact national paid leave for all workers ASAP. I'm laying out the case in the @indystar. https://t.co/HJ3OYyUEBm

I joined my colleagues in sending this letter. It is absolutely unacceptable that the Trump Administration is trying to censor public health information in the middle of a pandemic. We'll beat #COVID19 by relying on facts and data, not suppressing them.
https://t.co/zwpJ18ZyL0

Beginning today, a face covering in public is required in Marion County. This small sacrifice can go a long way in saving lives. Click the link below for more details on this ordinance and to apply for a free face covering. #MaskUpIndy @IndyOPHS 
https://t.co/SiML7Z6Xj2
RT @RepBarbaraLee: Denying access to contraception is denying access to essential healthcare. Today’s decision puts healthcare in the hands…

This is a senseless & reckless decision that will surely cost lives by undermining the global fight against #COVID19.
 
America should lead this effort. Instead, we lead the world in infections & deaths 
 
We have to change course & rejoin the global effort to stop this pandemic. https://t.co/1g3SAm8DOX
RT @RepJudyChu: 30,000 DACA recipients currently work in healthcare fighting the coronavirus pandemic Trump has allowed to get out of contr…

BIG NEWS: @EskenaziHealth received over $38 million in funds from @HHSGov to help it continue leading the fight against #COVID19. I was honored to join w/ @RepVisclosky to secure this investment & will keep working to build up our public health system as we combat this pandemic.
Mask up, Marion County! https://t.co/NedWmfBtd0

Today, the House continues to fight back by passing The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Enhancement Act (H.R. 1425). This bill strengthens the #ACA in a number of critical ways, including helping to reduce health disparities in communities of color. https://t.co/zZ3gO8XziF

Even in the middle of the #COVID19 pandemic, President Trump is still trying to destroy the #AffordableCareAct, which would rip health care coverage from millions of Americans.  

Not on our watch.

Extremely pleased by this ruling. Some states tried to chip away at women's reproductive rights, and this ruling helps curb this extreme agenda. However, there's more work to do. I'll keep fighting in Congress to protect #womenshealth in Indiana and across America. https://t.co/KKiExBq4XV

#COVID19 Economic Impact Payments generally belong to recipients, not their nursing homes and long-term care facilities. Be sure to let your friends and loved ones know, and visit https://t.co/WqP7uWSFxl to stay informed. https://t.co/QFmZoGgydh

I’m sending my deepest sympathies to my good friend and colleague, @Ilhan, upon the loss of her father from complications from COVID-19. I know how much he meant to you, and I know you will continue to make him proud.

I'm honored to introduce the COVID-19 Memorial Quilt Act of 2020 (H.R. 7161). Inspired by the NAMES Project AIDS Memorial Quilt, this bill will help give people across America the opportunity to properly honor loved ones lost to this horrible virus. https://t.co/7HhakurwRI

Nearly 10% of their members have tested positive or been quarantined from the virus. We must do more to keep workers safe, and keep our transportation system moving.

#ToThoseWhoKeepUsMoving

Today’s @TransportDems hearing on COVID-19's impacts on transportation workers tells a powerful story. 

For one group, More than 122 @transportworker members died from COVID-19, a virus they almost certainly contracted while continuing to work in public as essential employees.

Today, I encourage everybody to #WearOrange for #GunViolenceAwarenessDay. Our country is in the midst of a gun violence epidemic that disproportionately harms Black & Brown communities. I'll continue working to enact common-sense gun safety reforms that protect all Americans. https://t.co/PGiAAffUsJ
RT @RepDonBeyer: Adding jobs is good news. BUT this economic disaster was caused by the virus, and like the pandemic the long term picture…

Pres. Trump's decision to terminate America's partnership with @WHO undermines our global fight against this pandemic. We must work more closely with the global community to save lives and develop vaccines, not isolate ourselves from the cooperation needed to combat #COVID19.

More than 100,000 of our fellow Americans have died of #COVID19. In addition, that's countless grieving loved ones, countless dreams dashed, and countless life milestones missed. The grief is unimaginable, but we must stay strong and continue to fight this virus in their honor. https://t.co/ZDPO0MhfAj

Tonight at 7:00 pm I’ll be participating in another @FOX59 live town hall focusing on #COVID19. I’m looking forward to answering your questions about the work that lies ahead to save lives and protect jobs. You can also stream it live at https://t.co/Y5dCfKQvOo. #IndianaTownHall

I want to give a big thanks to Dr. Anthony Fauci, who participated in a call today with my colleagues and I in the @NewDemCoalition. He provided invaluable insight that will improve our efforts to help prevent the spread of #COVID19 and safely reopen our economy.

This isn't a wish list. These are necessary and common-sense measures we must take to protect Americans' health and economic well-being. I urge the Senate and President Trump to put partisanship aside and support this legislation for the benefit of all Americans.

The House has passed the #HeroesAct, another major #COVID19 relief bill that:

- Provides $75 billion for testing, tracing & treatment

- Gives more support to frontline heroes

- Issues a 2nd round of direct payments to Americans

- Sends more help to small businesses

- & more.

Last night, the House passed the #HeroesAct — our latest #COVID19 relief package to provide much-needed support to our frontline heroes and others harmed by the crisis in Indiana and across America. Lets put partisanship aside and make it law. Read more: https://t.co/WSjFO9aSyI
Don’t miss the @BlueAngels flyover today at 2pm — but be sure to socially distance while you watch this tribute to our frontline #COVID19 responders! https://t.co/V4S5tq7F2q

In my latest op-ed in the @IndyRecorder, I write about #COVID19's devastating impact on Black America, and how we must tackle this crisis more equitably.
https://t.co/2YrFIsGvGX

A reminder: Please check the @IRSnews website regularly to find the latest guidance and instructions on how to receive your #COVID19 economic impact payments:
https://t.co/1ixBSGSVJK

Today is #NationalNursesDay, as well as #NationalNursesWeek. We can't thank these health care heroes enough! Every day, they are on the front lines, risking their health to protect ours. Through this crisis and beyond, we must keep working to get them they resources they need. https://t.co/jhtJ8YmfIY
I am pleased to help lead this important effort. We need to do much more to protect our seniors from #COVID19, and that can't happen without more testing. https://t.co/Zq8G61H11R
RT @WhipClyburn: The coronavirus pandemic is making clear to all that broadband is the ‘next greatest thing’ for many in the 21st century.…

The public health data is clear: It's simply too soon to safely begin reopening Indiana. @StateHealthIN shows a continued growth of #COVID19 infections. We have yet to #flattenthecurve. A premature reopening of public places could cost lives and lengthen this pandemic. https://t.co/7pSZlWx4gL

#COVID19 has made the health disparities that have long existed in America even more apparent. That’s why I continue working w/ @CAPAC @HispanicCaucus & @TheBlackCaucus during #MinorityHealthMonth to take on structural inequalities that contribute to these disparities. #NMHM2020

I'm pleased to announce that @INDairport and other local airports have received more than $50 million in additional funds through the #CARESAct. I'll keep working to help our aviation employees and all other workers harmed by the #COVID19 pandemic.
https://t.co/tckKwr3bjH

The #COVID19 crisis has sadly sparked an alarming rise in incidents of #domesticviolence. Now, more than ever, we must protect those at risk. That's why I'm honored to support @RepWexton's legislation to provide more resources for local law enforcement responding to these cases. https://t.co/3JWi2ZTGJE

#COVID19's devastation in communities of color in Southwest Georgia, and the state's premature reopening, are stark lessons for Indiana and the whole country. The virus does not discriminate, and we must make sure our government's response doesn't either. 
https://t.co/IPK5fcSyxe

My heart remains with the people of #Kashmir during this challenging time. The draconian restrictions placed upon them by PM Modi are not only taking away their basic human rights, but also making it more difficult to protect against #COVID19. These unjust restrictions must end!

Pleased that Congress has come together to provide nearly $500 billion more dollars for small business owners, hospitals, and additional testing in our fight against #COVID19. I'll keep working hard to get even more help for Hoosiers who need it most.
https://t.co/XbPPqIqaIV

Wishing a #RamadanMubarak to all of my fellow Muslims in Indiana, across America, and around the world who are celebrating #Ramadan! Though #COVID19 will keep many of us physically apart, I have no doubt that this special season will unite our faith community more than ever. https://t.co/dynJ9ECuTE
Great news! Let’s keep working to increase testing, particularly for those in our community who have been disproportionately affected. https://t.co/MTxlCfrUwX

I thank all my fellow Muslims who have been engaged in the effort to defeat #COVID19. Whether staying at home, working on the front lines, or volunteering in a number of ways, our community has remained united to protect our family, friends and neighbors. Let’s keep it up!

Happy #EarthDay! The current #COVID19 crisis has shown that we have to work together as a global community to keep people healthy. The same goes for keeping our planet healthy. Let's recommit ourselves to protecting our environment for all of us, and for future generations. https://t.co/aC7LphMCG2
We cannot have a healthy economy without healthy people. Period.

#ToThoseWhoKeepUsMoving: Thank you for your hard work to help our country defeat #COVID19. From transit workers to truck drivers, aviation employees & many more -- we simply could not get through this without you. We'll keep working to get you the support you need. @TransportDems https://t.co/6zZsgOK7Kk

President Trump claims the #COVID19 pandemic is improving and we can begin to reopen. Yet he also claims it’s so bad we must close our nation’s doors to all immigrants? His handling of this crisis isn’t based in logic. It’s based in his own reckless, dangerous agenda.

#COVID19 is a global crisis & we must work together as a global community to solve it. Pres. Trump's decision to cut funding for @WHO greatly jeopardizes our efforts to save lives. He should be more concerned with finding solutions than blaming others for his disastrous response.

BREAKING: @FEMA has approved IN's request for a disaster declaration. That means our state will now have additional resources & flexibility to respond boldly to the #COVID19 crisis. I'll continue working closely with state & local leaders to help get us through this challenge.

Today is #EqualPayDay, which represents how far into 2020 a woman must work to make as much money as a man makes in 2019 alone.

Women are in the front lines of the #COVID19 pandemic, risking their lives for us all. All of them, and all women, deserve equal pay for equal work.
